dfischer.utils

Class SlowlorisConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.SlowlorisConfig

  • public class SlowlorisConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration data for the Slowloris algorithm. Note that two separate configurations (= two instances of this class) are required - one for the HTTP requests and another one for the HTTP responses.
    Since:
    V5.4-F

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Initialize the configuration data with default settings.

      Initialize the configuration data with specific settings.

      • SlowlorisConfig

        public SlowlorisConfig(int minFragmentSizeBytes,
               int maxFragmentSizeBytes,
               long minFragmentMillis,
               long maxFragmentMillis)
        Initialize the configuration data with specific settings.
        Parameters:
        minFragmentSizeBytes - the minimum size of a data fragment in bytes
        maxFragmentSizeBytes - the maximum size of a data fragment in bytes
        minFragmentMillis - the minimum wait time between the data fragments in milliseconds
        maxFragmentMillis - the maximum wait time between the data fragments in milliseconds

      • dump

        public void dump()
        Dump the configuration data to stdout.

      • parseArgs

        public static SlowlorisConfig parseArgs(java.lang.String[] args,
                        java.lang.String commandPrefix)
        Parse the configuration data from a command line. Example: -slowlorisReq:16,80,20,50 (commandPrefix = "-slowlorisReq:")
        Parameter 1: min fragment size (bytes)
        Parameter 2: max fragment size (bytes)
        Parameter 3: min fragment delay (milliseconds)
        Parameter 4: max fragment delay (milliseconds)
        Parameters:
        args - the arguments of the command line
        Returns:
        An initialized instance of the the configuration data, or null if no configuration data was found.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Internal test program. Read the configuration data from the command line and dump them out.
        Example: java dfischer.utils.SlowlorisConfig -slowloris:2,4,10,20
